markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 3" pfs="Standard">
[Feet to Fins](/Spells.aspx?ID=1525)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Morph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=113" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 331 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Besmara](/Deities.aspx?ID=332), [Dagon](/Deities.aspx?ID=429), [Jin Li](/Deities.aspx?ID=308), [Picoperi](/Deities.aspx?ID=651), [Ragadahn](/Deities.aspx?ID=459), [Seafarer's Hope](/Deities.aspx?ID=255), [Sobek](/Deities.aspx?ID=642), [Telastmar](/Deities.aspx?ID=549), [Ylimancha](/Deities.aspx?ID=488)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of the Shark](/Lessons.aspx?ID=28)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

The target's feet transform into fins, improving mobility in the water but reducing it on land. The target gains a swim Speed equal to its normal land Speed, but its land Speed becomes 5 feet.

---
**Heightened (6th)** The spell lasts until your next daily preparations.
name: Feet to Fins

**Deities**
[Besmara](/Deities.aspx?ID=332), [Dagon](/Deities.aspx?ID=429), [Jin Li](/Deities.aspx?ID=308), [Picoperi](/Deities.aspx?ID=651), [Ragadahn](/Deities.aspx?ID=459), [Seafarer's Hope](/Deities.aspx?ID=255), [Sobek](/Deities.aspx?ID=642), [Telastmar](/Deities.aspx?ID=549), [Ylimancha](/Deities.aspx?ID=488)

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

 

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>
</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Turn a creature's feet into fins, enabling it to swim but slowing it on land.
</summary>
summary: Turn a creature's feet into fins, enabling it to swim but slowing it on land.
